him to the door, repeating some- thing to him several times in low tones. 
When the Military Governor had gone, Prince Vasfli sat down all alone on a chair in the ballroom, crossing one leg high over the other, leaning his elbow on his knee and cover- ing his face with his hand. After sitting so for a while he rose, and, looking about him with frightened eyes, went with unusually hurried steps down the long corridor leading to the back of the house, to the room of the eldest princess.
